meanings.definition: A person or thing of enormous size or power.
meanings.sent1: The elephant was a goliath compared to the tiny mouse.
meanings.sent2: The mountain stood like a goliath in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The goliath of a cake towered over the other desserts at the party.
meanings.sent4: His influence in the industry was a goliath, overshadowing all competitors.
meanings.sent5: The storm approached like a goliath, darkening the sky with its power.

meanings.definition: A giant Philistine warrior defeated by David in the Bible.
meanings.sent1: In the story, David bravely faced the goliath with just a sling.
meanings.sent2: The goliath's armor gleamed in the sunlight as he marched towards David.
meanings.sent3: The goliath's defeat by David was a lesson in courage and faith.
meanings.sent4: Facing your fears can make you feel like David standing against a goliath.
meanings.sent5: The goliath's roar echoed through the valley, striking fear into the hearts of the Israelites.

meanings.definition: A very large or powerful organization or person.
meanings.sent1: The tech company had grown into a goliath in the industry.
meanings.sent2: The political candidate was seen as a goliath in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The goliath of a corporation swallowed up smaller businesses in its path.
meanings.sent4: She faced the goliath of public speaking with determination and practice.
meanings.sent5: The goliath of a storm raged outside, shaking the windows with its power.
